title: Creating an Equation
text: Let w represent the width. We know that the area of a triangle is $$\frac{1}{2}$$ * height * width. 4w-2 is the height, while w is the width. So, $$area=\frac{1}{2\left(4w-2\right)} w$$. The area is $$45$$, so our final equation is $$2w^2-w-45=0$$

title: Solving the Equation
text: Using the quadratic formula, we get $$w=5, w=\frac{-9}{2}$$. We can remove the negative solution. So, the width is $$5$$, which means that the height is $$18$$.
